page.title: 08THE GYPSIES I
page.content: IN OUR AREA THERE ARE A LOT OF SMALL FIELDS WHERE WE SEE THE GYPSY HORSES,THEY EVEN COME ON OUR PLAYING FIELDS.MANY GYPSIES LIVE ON A SPECIAL SITE ON ROVER WAY.THERE ARE SPACES FOR 45 CARAVANS,BUT AS MOST FAMILIES HAVE 2 VANS EACH THERE ARE ONLY 21 FAMILIES LIVING IN THE CAMP.THEY HAVE TOILETS BUT NO SHOWERS OR BATHS.THE COUNCIL IS BUILDING A SITE NEXT DOOR WHICH WILL HAVE SHOWERS FOR THEM.WE TALKED TO A MAN WITH BLACK HAIR AND A BEARD,AND A SILVER EARING,WHO WE THINK WAS A GYPSY.HE TOLD US THAT EACH FAMILY HAS ABOUT 7 CHILDREN THE YOUNG CHILDREN GO TO SCHOOL BUT AFTER THEY REACH 12 THEY SEEM TO STAY AWAY.WE SAW TWO GYPSY BOYS AGED 15 AND 17 DRIVING A CAR ON THE MAIN ROAD AND WE WERE FRIGHTENED BY THE WILD WAY THEY DROVE. IN A FIELD OPPOSITE THE CAMP WERE HORSES BELONGING TO TWO OF THE
